results.title: Australian diary. No. 029
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This cinemagazine features: The pearl shell harvest at Broome; the development of a school of industrial design at East Sydney Technical College; the manufacture of paper in Tasmania; the Sydney Glider Club.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 028
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: cadet ship-builders at Whyalla; Tasmania’s historic bridges are put under the spotlight; the tanning and leather industry in Sydney is shown and European migrants give a concert at Canberra.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 027
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The marvel of mechanisation at a Melbourne Match Factory is featured in this newsreel. Hagley Area School near Launceston providing primary and trade education for country children is visited by the camera. Scientists go to Antarctica to study weather while an Australian relief crew with 12 months supplies sails to Heard Island to take over from the homecoming crew.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a play centre/nursery school opens in Canberra; Norris E. Dodd, United Nations Director of Food, outlines the world food position; overseas telecommunications are featured and a closer look at Broken Hill is shown.

results.brief_description: The magazine items in this program features the growing pains of Sydney as the city develops and expands; training for women to become forestry officers in New South Wales; and a scientific expedition to Arnhem Land in the Northern Territory.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 024
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This interesting cinemagazine features the following items: a look at the life of Dr. Geoffrey Young, a flying doctor in the outback; mulga wood crafts and holidaying on the Great Barrier Reef, one of the world’s greatest coral wonderlands.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 022
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Scientists make strange finds in Arnhem Land during the American-Australian Scientific Expedition. They studied birds, fish and the culture of local Aboriginal peoples. A potter from Melbounre demonstrates a variation of the coil method of using clay. Koalas are born and reared in a sanctuary along with kangaroos and dingoes at the Lone Pine Koala Sanctuary near Brisbane.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian diary. No. 021
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Medical aid for the children of the far west. Officials of the Far Wesr Children’s Health Scheme visit Tibooburra school and aboriginal camp on the Queensland border. Experts milk lake trout of their eggs which are hatched at the hatchery and young trout are released back to the rivers in Victoria. Toronga Park Zoo kindergarten caters for young animal lovers. Modern machinery revolutionises heavy work; a demonstration of heavy machinery available to Australian industries from the Commonwealth Handling Equipment Pool.
